com.pump.print

Class PrintLayout

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pump.print.PrintLayout

  • public class PrintLayout
extends java.lang.Object
    This encapsulates information about the layout of several tiles on one page.

    All length information on this page is presented in 1/72 of an inch. So insets of (72,72,72,72) are 1-inch insets. This is keeping in convention with Java's printing conventions.

    The following are elements in this layout information:

    • Header/Footer: this is html-formatted text that may appear at the top/bottom of each page.
    • Insets: these are margins for this page.
    • Inner Padding: this is the space that will appear between all components. This includes the space between cells, and the space between cells and headers/footers.
    • Flip Pattern: an array of flip instructions that will be followed alternatingly. For example, an array of {NONE, NONE, BOTH, BOTH} will flip the last 2 tiles, so if you folder the paper correctly you can make 4 tiles into a greeting card. I know, it's complicated... and if you don't ever want to flip tiles: you never need to use it.

      • toString

        public static java.lang.String toString(java.awt.print.PageFormat f)
        This describes a PageFormat as a String. This is provided as a debugging tool, because PageFormat.toString() doesn't support this itself.

      • getPaperImageableBounds

        public java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D getPaperImageableBounds()
        Returns the imageable bounds of the paper

      • setPaperImageableBounds

        public boolean setPaperImageableBounds(java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D r)
        This adjusts the imageable bounds of the paper. It is not recommended that you use this method directly. The methods that set the insets, paper width, paper height, and orientation automatically adjust this property for you to fit your needs.
        Parameters:
        r - the new imageable bounds.
        Returns:
        true if a change occurred.

        Parameters:

      • createPrintable

        public java.awt.print.Printable createPrintable(Paintable[] paintables,
                                                int pgNumber,
                                                int pgCount)
        Create a printable object from several tiles using this layout.
        Parameters:
        paintables - the tiles to arrange.
        pgNumber - the page number to start counting from in the header/footer. In most cases this should be zero, but for some previews it can be a preset value.

        This value is used to replace the text "<PageNumber/" in the header/footer text.

        pgCount - the total number of pages.

        This value is used to replace the text "<PageCount/" in the header/footer text.

        Returns:
        a printable object based on the arguments provided.

      • createPaintables

        public Paintable[] createPaintables(Paintable[] paintables,
                                    int pgNumber,
                                    int pgCount)
        Create several pages of Paintable objects using input tiles that are arranged according to this layout.
        Parameters:
        paintables -
        pgNumber - the page number to start counting from in the header/footer. In most cases this can be zero, but for some previews it can be a preset value.

        This value is used to replace the text "<PageNumber/" in the header/footer text.

        pgCount - the total number of pages.

        This value is used to replace the text "<PageCount/" in the header/footer text.

        Returns:
        1 or more pages that arrange the incoming tiles as necessary.

      • getCellLayout

        public java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D[][] getCellLayout(int cellCount)
        Returns a matrix of Rectangle2Ds describing how to lay out a certain number of cells. Each element of the array is a page, and within each page can be multiple tiles.

        This will allow space for a header and/or footer if appropriate, but that rectangle is not included in the returned set of rectangles from this method.

        Parameters:
        cellCount - the number of cells to design for.
        Returns:
        multiple pages, with multiple cells on each page.
